about.title: About Me
about.summary: I’m a Software Developer specializing in scalable, high-performance backend systems. My core stack is <highlight>Java</highlight>, with growing experience in <highlight>Rust</highlight> and <highlight>Next.js</highlight>. I work end-to-end from code to production using containerized services, <highlight>Kubernetes</highlight>, <highlight>Helm</highlight>, and <highlight>GitOps</highlight>-focused workflows. I care about clean code, clear abstractions, and well-tested, reliable systems that are easy to operate and evolve.

resume.summary: Experienced software engineer with 5+ years of expertise in building scalable web applications. Passionate about clean code, modern technologies, and solving complex problems.

achievements: Investigated and reproduced gameplay and backend issues on a large-scale Minecraft server network, helping developers diagnose root causes and improve overall stability over time.
Handled live incident reports from players and internal monitoring, quickly reproducing issues, assessing impact and ensuring critical problems were escalated and tracked to resolution.
Collaborated closely with developers and community staff to reproduce, triage and verify fixes for critical production issues.
experience.title: Quality Assurance Engineer

achievements: Designed and implemented backend services and data-processing pipelines primarily in Java (e.g. Spring Boot) and TypeScript/Node.js, with selected components in Rust where performance or safety was critical, exposing REST and gRPC APIs with clear contracts and strong validation.
Built and maintained CI/CD pipelines (e.g. GitHub Actions) and Kubernetes-based deployments, automating tests, security checks and releases for multiple services.

Provisioned and operated backend infrastructure (databases, message brokers, caches and reverse proxies), using infrastructure-as-code and monitoring to keep systems reliable, observable and easy to debug.
experience.title: Independent Software Engineer

achievements: Implemented and maintained gameplay and backend features for large-scale Minecraft minigames, with a focus on stability, debuggability and player impact.
Investigated complex production bugs across multiple plugins and services, turning vague reports into reproducible cases and concrete fixes in the codebase.
Worked closely with product, community and operations teams to plan and deliver gameplay features, incorporating player feedback into the development roadmap.
experience.title: Software Engineer

achievements: Implemented core front-end and back-end engine components for an internal and external development platform in Java, TypeScript and Rust, enabling teams to build and integrate services consistently across the stack.
Built and maintained CI/CD and GitOps workflows on Kubernetes-based infrastructure, standardizing deployments, release strategies and configuration across multiple services and environments.

Implemented partner-specific features and integrations as white-labeled solutions on top of the platform, allowing partners to deliver customised products while relying on the shared core infrastructure and tooling.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: This privacy policy explains how your personal data is processed when you visit this website.
privacy.controller:
<heading>1. Controller</heading><addressBlock>Name: {controllerName}
Address: {controllerAddress}
Email: <emailLink>{controllerEmail}</emailLink>
Contact form: <link>{secondContact}</link></addressBlock><text>
The controller within the meaning of Art. 4(7) GDPR is the person named above.</text>
privacy.general: <heading>2. General Information</heading><text>This website is a personal portfolio for professional presentation as a software engineer. Personal data is processed only to the extent necessary to provide and secure this website and to respond to contact requests. The legal basis is our legitimate interest in a functional and secure online presence (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR) and, where applicable, the performance or initiation of a contract (Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR).</text>
privacy.encryption: <heading>3. SSL/TLS Encryption</heading><text>This website uses SSL/TLS encryption for security reasons and to protect the transmission of confidential content. You can recognize an encrypted connection by the "https://" prefix in your browser's address bar and the lock icon. When SSL/TLS encryption is active, data you transmit to us cannot be read by third parties.</text>
privacy.logs: <heading>4. Access Data and Logs</heading><text>When visiting this website, the server automatically records log files (IP address, date and time of access, browser type and version, operating system, referrer URL, requested page and amount of data transferred). This data is processed to ensure the security and stability of the website and to detect and investigate misuse. Log files are kept for up to {logRetentionDays} days and then deleted, unless further storage is required for evidence purposes. Server location: {serverLocation}. The legal basis is our legitimate interest in secure and reliable operation of the website (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR).</text>
privacy.cloudflare: <heading>5. Use of Cloudflare</heading><text>This website is delivered through a Cloudflare Tunnel provided by {cloudflareProvider}. For this purpose, Cloudflare processes technical connection data (in particular IP addresses, requested URLs, system configuration information and other metadata) to deliver and secure the website (e.g. DDoS protection, performance optimization). Cloudflare processes this data as a processor on our behalf under a data processing agreement. Depending on your location, data may be transferred to data centers outside the EU, including the USA. These transfers are protected by Standard Contractual Clauses and Cloudflare's certification under the EU-U.S. Data Privacy Framework adequacy decision. Processing is based on our legitimate interest in secure and efficient operation of the website (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR). Further information can be found in Cloudflare's privacy policy: <link>{cloudflarePolicyUrl}</link>.</text>
privacy.contact: <heading>6. Contact</heading><text>If you contact me by email, the data you provide (in particular email address, name and the content of your message) will be processed for the purpose of handling and responding to your request. The legal basis is Art. 6(1)(b) GDPR where the contact relates to an existing or potential contractual relationship, and otherwise Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR (our legitimate interest in processing inquiries). Your data will not be shared with third parties unless this is necessary to process your request or required by law, and will be deleted when your inquiry has been conclusively answered, unless statutory retention obligations apply.</text>
privacy.rights: <heading>7. Data Subject Rights</heading><text>You have the rights granted by Articles 15–21 GDPR: in particular the right of access, rectification, erasure, restriction of processing, data portability and objection to processing based on Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR. Where processing is based on consent, you may withdraw consent at any time with effect for the future. You also have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority, in particular in the Member State of your habitual residence or place of work (Art. 77 GDPR).</text>
privacy.cookies: <heading>8. Cookies and Browser Storage</heading><text>This website uses one technically necessary cookie and browser local storage entries:</text><text>Cookie:</text><list><listItem>NEXT_LOCALE: Stores your language preference (e.g., "de", "en"). Session cookie, expires when you close your browser.</listItem></list><text>Local Storage:</text><list><listItem>theme: Stores your theme preference ("light" or "dark").</listItem><listItem>i18nextLng: Stores your language preference (e.g., "en-US").</listItem></list><text>These functions are required to provide the website in the selected language and with your chosen display settings. No profiling or cross-site tracking takes place. The legal basis for storing and accessing this information is § 25(2) TTDSG and our legitimate interest in a user-friendly presentation of the website (Art. 6(1)(f) GDPR). You can delete these entries at any time via your browser settings.</text>
privacy.noTracking: <heading>9. No Tracking or Analytics</heading><text>This website uses no tracking tools, analytics services, advertising networks or social media plugins. No personal data is shared with third parties for marketing or profiling purposes.</text>
privacy.changes: <heading>10. Changes</heading><text>This privacy policy may be updated if technical or legal changes occur. The latest version will always be available on this page.</text>
